comment.author: 85572475@N00
comment._content: "Alvin Adams (June 16, 1804 – September 2, 1877) was the founder of Adams and Company, a forerunner to Adams Express, one of the first companies to act as a carrier for express shipments by rail in the United States. Adams and Company provided shippers with a complete shipping solution, picking up goods at the shipper's location, carrying them to the railroad terminal, and then delivering them from the distant railroad terminal to the recipient's door." (from wikipedia)

comment.author: 87085448@N00
comment._content: For whatever reason it makes me think of Mr. Rochester, from Jane Eyre.

comment.author: 30744708@N00
comment._content:
this is one of those incredible photos that transcends the generations. there's something very... immediate... about it. i'm waiting for him to whip his head around and bark an order. maybe it's the furrow in the brow. you can feel the weight of his personality. i like this SO much better than the posed, frozen older ladies on their queen anne settees with their lapdogs. there's no connection to me in my time, aside from mere curiosity. this fella has energy.... that energy that fast-moving, fast-thinking business innovators have.... vision...

.... i digress. eh-hem. nice photo! :) .... and yes, blue, a big mr. rochesterish!

comment.author: 78546566@N00
comment._content: A dashing man, an awesome portrait.

comment.author: 84465035@N00
comment._content: He's handsome! I love the way the clothing in these old photos is always visibly handmade, hand-stitched, as can be seen in the soft rumpling around the seams. Used as we are to machine-made clothing these days, it looks curiously imperfect but was of course the norm at the time - and doubtless very good quality too, in this case.

comment._content: A very noble face!  I agree with everything katiew says, very great portrait!
